summary: Build a clothing website with an aesthetic concept blending Ed Hardy and True Religion, and incorporate designs themed around 'good triumphs over evil' while keeping the same style.
known_issues: Many product images are not rendering/visible in the storefront UI.
Several product images appear duplicated across different products.
Product labels/titles/descriptions do not match the actual clothing shown in the associated product images (data-to-image mapping mismatch).
imageRequirements:

- Flat-lay product photo: tattoo-flash graphic T-shirt design with distressed ink texture, black/cream/gold palette (product-new-design-01.dim_1200x1200.png)

- Flat-lay product photo: flannel overshirt embroidery featuring “Living Off Experience” banner + dagger motif (product-living-off-experience-08.dim_1200x1200.png)

- Flat-lay product photo: skirt or shorts with woven label reading “Living Off Experience”, distressed fabric texture (product-living-off-experience-10.dim_1200x1200.png)

existing_features.title: Create a multi-page clothing storefront UI with the following pages and navigation: Home, Shop (product grid), Product Details, Cart, About/Brand, and Contact.

Implement a coherent visual theme that blends tattoo/rock graphics with premium denim/western embellishment (distressed textures, ornate motifs, bold typography) and apply it consistently across all pages (colors, type scale, buttons, cards, spacing). Do not use a blue/purple default theme.
Seed the catalog with a small set of sample products (e.g., 8–12 items) that match the requested fashion concept, each with images referencing the generated static assets, plus 2–4 collections.
Implement client-side cart functionality: add to cart from Product Details, update quantity, remove item, persist cart in local storage, and show cart count in the header.
Use React Query for catalog data fetching (product list, product detail, collections) with loading and error states that match the site theme.
Add a Contact page with a simple form (name, email, message) and a local-only submission flow (no external email provider). Store submissions in the backend for later review.
Add generated image assets to the project and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (logo, hero, background texture/pattern, and product images).

Update the site’s visual storytelling to reflect a clear “good triumphs over evil” theme while keeping the existing tattoo/rock + premium denim/western embellishment aesthetic (distressed textures, ornate motifs, bold typography). Apply this motif consistently on key pages (at minimum Home and About) via iconography, section headings, and short brand copy updates (English only).

Add and wire up new generated static image assets that visually depict “good triumphs over evil” in the existing style. Update frontend image mapping so the new themed products and/or hero visuals can reference these new assets from frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update the frontend image key-to-asset mapping so all newly added products (the 22 additional designs and the 10 “Living Off Experience” designs) resolve to valid static image paths via the existing image resolver utilities.
Add new generated static product image assets for the newly added designs and place them under frontend/public/assets/generated, matching the filenames referenced by the frontend image mapping.

Audit and correct the frontend product image key-to-asset mapping so every product image key used by the backend catalog resolves to the intended static asset path and does not incorrectly reuse another product’s image.
Ensure all product image assets referenced by the frontend image mapping exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and load successfully in the UI (no broken images).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a clothing website reflecting a fashion concept between Ed Hardy and True Religion.

Add a backend product catalog in the single Motoko actor, including types and stable storage for: Product (id, name, price, description, images, tags, collection) and Collection (id, name). Provide public query methods to list collections, list products (optionally filter by collection/tag), and fetch a product by id.
Add product/graphic design direction so the catalog and visuals include a 'good triumphs over evil' theme while maintaining the existing Ed Hardy × True Religion-inspired style.

Update the seeded catalog data to include products (and/or product tags/descriptions) that reflect the “good triumphs over evil” theme while staying consistent with the existing Ed Hardy × True Religion-inspired product concept. Ensure the frontend can surface these products without breaking existing filtering/navigation.

Expand the catalog by adding 22 additional product designs across a mix of clothing types, and ensure each new product is assigned to the correct category/collection for accurate browsing and filtering.
Add 10 additional product designs themed around the phrase "living off Experience" while keeping the overall site aesthetic consistent, and categorize them correctly in the catalog.

Expand the seeded backend product catalog to add 22 additional product designs (a mixture of clothing types), ensuring each new product is assigned to the correct existing collection/category for accurate browsing and filtering in the Shop page.

Add 10 additional product designs themed around the phrase “Living Off Experience” while keeping the existing overall fashion aesthetic, and ensure these 10 products are correctly categorized for Shop filtering (either by adding a dedicated collection/category or by using an existing appropriate collection consistently).

Audit and update seeded backend product catalog entries so product names/descriptions match the clothing depicted by their associated image keys, and each product’s image keys correspond to the correct assets in the frontend mapping.

projectName: Fashion-forward clothing storefront (Ed Hardy × True Religion-inspired aesthetic)
